record.titel: Above Below the Level of Water with a Probability of Flooding (i.e. a Dike)
Pi_x000D_ Man According to Pi_x000D_ History 097 Pi_x000D_ Red, Yellow, Blue_x000D_ History 228 Pi in Phi_x000D_ Fugue pour les survivants XIII

I’m sorry but I don’t want to be an Emperor—that’s not my business—I don’t want to rule or_x000D_ conquer anyone. I should like to help everyone if possible, Jew, gentile, black man, white. We_x000D_ all want to help one another, human beings are like that. We all want to live by each other’s_x000D_ happiness, not by each other’s misery. We don’t want to hate and despise one another. In this_x000D_ world there is room for everyone and the earth is rich and can provide for everyone. The way_x000D_ of life can be free and beautiful. But we have lost the way. Greed has poisoned men’s souls—_x000D_ has barricaded the world with hate; has goose-stepped us into misery and bloodshed. We have_x000D_ developed speed but we have shut ourselves in: machinery that gives abundance has left us in_x000D_ want. Our knowledge has made us cynical, our cleverness hard and unkind. We think too much_x000D_ and feel too little: More than machinery we need humanity; More than cleverness we need_x000D_ kindness and gentleness. Without these qualities, life will be violent and all will be lost. The_x000D_ aeroplane and the radio have brought us closer together. The very nature of these inventions_x000D_ cries out for the goodness in men, cries out for universal brotherhood for the unity of us all._x000D_ Even now my voice is reaching millions throughout the world, millions of despairing men,_x000D_ women and little children, victims of a system that makes men torture and imprison innocent_x000D_ people. To those who can hear me I say “Do not despair.” The misery that is now upon us is_x000D_ but the passing of greed, the bitterness of men who fear the way of human progress: the hate_x000D_ of men will pass and dictators die and the power they took from the people will return to the_x000D_ people, and so long as men die [now] liberty will never perish.… Soldiers—don’t give_x000D_ yourselves to brutes, men who despise you and enslave you—who regiment your lives, tell_x000D_ you what to do, what to think and what to feel, who drill you, diet you, treat you as cattle, as_x000D_ cannon fodder. Don’t give yourselves to these unnatural men, machine men, with machine_x000D_ minds and machine hearts. You are not machines. You are not cattle. You are men. You have_x000D_ the love of humanity in your hearts. You don’t hate—only the unloved hate. Only the unloved_x000D_ and the unnatural. Soldiers—don’t fight for slavery, fight for liberty. In the seventeenth chapter_x000D_ of Saint Luke it is written “the kingdom of God is within man”—not one man, nor a group of_x000D_ men—but in all men—in you, the people. You the people have the power, the power to create_x000D_ machines, the power to create happiness. You the people have the power to make life free and_x000D_ beautiful, to make this life a wonderful adventure. Then in the name of democracy let’s use that_x000D_ power—let us all unite. Let us fight for a new world, a decent world that will give men a chance_x000D_ to work, that will give you the future and old age and security. By the promise of these things,_x000D_ brutes have risen to power, but they lie. They do not fulfill their promise, they never will._x000D_ Dictators free themselves but they enslave the people. Now let us fight to fulfill that promise._x000D_ Let us fight to free the world, to do away with national barriers, do away with greed, with hate_x000D_ and intolerance. Let us fight for a world of reason, a world where science and progress will_x000D_ lead to all men’s happiness. Soldiers—in the name of democracy, let us all unite! Look up!_x000D_ Look up! The clouds are lifting—the sun is breaking through. We are coming out of the_x000D_ darkness into the light. We are coming into a new world. A kind new world where men will rise_x000D_ above their hate and brutality. The soul of man has been given wings—and at last he is_x000D_ beginning to fly. He is flying into the rainbow—into the light of hope—into the future, that_x000D_ glorious future that belongs to you, to me and to all of us. Look up. Look up.
One-Thousandth of a Second to One Second
